Class FunctionalArrayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ArrayList
      • FunctionalArrayList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FunctionalList, List

    public class FunctionalArrayList
extends ArrayList
implements FunctionalList
    A functional list is a list with a few additional methods that are common in functional languages (such as Lisp, Clojure, or Haskell) to work with lists in a recursive way. Not all operations on a recursive list will always be successful. For example, a programmer may try to extract the head from an empty list. Since we hace not covered exceptions yet, we need another mechanism to report errors. In order to do that, methods of this list will return a ReturnObject that will contain either an object or an error value of the right kind (as defined in ErrorMessage). Implementation based on ArrayList by Chris Grocott

    • Method Detail

      • head

        public ReturnObject head()
        Returns the element at the beginning of the list. If the list is empty, an appropriate error is returned.
        Specified by:
        head in interface FunctionalList
        Returns:
        a copy of the element at the beginning of the list or an error if the list is empty.

      • rest

        public FunctionalList rest()
        Returns a list with the elements in this list except the head. The elements must be in the same order. The original list must not change or be affected by changes in the new list. If the list is empty, another empty list is returned.
        Specified by:
        rest in interface FunctionalList
